pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the Zariski topology on the category of schemes. It may have some applications, but it should also be considered as a test case for the Grothendieck topologies API in order to check that is general enough, in particular in terms of universes: a priori, the category which shall form the small Ã©tale site of a scheme will have the same universe parameters.

---

```suggestion
    rintro X _ T âŸ¨U, rflâŸ© H
    choose V hV using H
    use U.bind (fun j => V (U.map j) âŸ¨jâŸ©)
    simpa only [OpenCover.bind, â† hV] using Presieve.ofArrows_bind U.obj U.map _
      (fun _ f H => (V f H).obj) (fun _ f H => (V f H).map)
```
I don't think we need `Presieve.ofArrows_bind'`?
I was just not good enough to use `ofArrows_bind` :-(

We should have this result
```
example {Y : Scheme.{u}} (U : OpenCover.{v} Y) :
  zariskiPretopology Y (Presieve.ofArrows U.obj U.map)
```
But I'm not sure if it is easy enough to fit in this relatively small PR.
Maybe add the `OpenCover.{u} Y` version and add a TODO note?

Thanks for the suggestion. I have included the `OpenCover.{u}` version as well as the following:
```lean
lemma zariskiTopology_openCover {Y : Scheme.{u}} (U : OpenCover.{v} Y) :
    zariskiTopology Y (Sieve.generate (Presieve.ofArrows U.obj U.map))
```
